Package com.bakdata.dedupe.matching

Interface BipartiteMatcher<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the record
    All Superinterfaces:
    Assigner<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStableMarriage, StronglyStableMarriage, WeaklyStableMarriage
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface BipartiteMatcher<T>
extends Assigner<T>
    Implements an algorithm that finds a matching in a bipartite graph.

    "A matching or independent edge set in a graph is a set of edges without common vertices."[1]

    Unless explicitly stated otherwise by the implementation, the two types of vertexes may be of different size and edges do not need to be complete; that is, certain matches may be impossible from the start. Edges may be negatively weighted if the implementation supports it and it is up to the implementation to either see them as discouraged or impossible, where non-existing edges should always be treated as impossible.

    [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matching_(graph_theory)

    See Also:
    Assigner - a matcher on a bipartite graph with undirected edges

    • Method Detail

      • match

        @NonNull
@NonNull java.lang.Iterable<WeightedEdge<T>> match​(@NonNull
                                                   @NonNull java.util.Collection<WeightedEdge<T>> leftToRightWeightedEdges,
                                                   @NonNull
                                                   @NonNull java.util.Collection<WeightedEdge<T>> rightToLeftWeightedEdges)
        Finds the set of edges forming a matching that maximizes the sum of the edge weights.

        Vertexes are implicitly given through the edges. Vertexes without any edge cannot be passed and are ignored. It's up to the caller to handle such cases.

        Parameters:
        leftToRightWeightedEdges - the set of possible edges coming from the left set of vertexes to the right ones and their respective weights.
        rightToLeftWeightedEdges - the set of possible edges from the right set of vertexes to the left ones and their respective weights.
        Returns:
        the set of edges as a subset of leftToRightWeightedEdges.
        API Note:
        The interface may use Iterables as the parameters in the future to facilitate an online applications. Use matchMaterialized(Collection, Collection) if you need an explicit Set.

        Description copied from interface: Assigner
        Finds the set of edges forming a matching that maximizes the sum of the edge weights.

        Vertexes are implicitly given through the edges. Vertexes without any edge cannot be passed and are ignored. It's up to the caller to handle such cases.

        Specified by:
        assign in interface Assigner<T>
        Parameters:
        weightedEdges - the set of possible edges and their respective weights.
        Returns:
        the set of edges.
        Implementation Note:
        Invokes match(Collection, Collection) by replicating the given weighted edges for both directions.
